title: Enrico Bombieri
summary: Enrico Bombieri (born 26 November 1940) is an Italian mathematician, known for his work in analytic number theory, Diophantine geometry, complex analysis, and group theory.[5] Bombieri is currently Professor Emeritus in the School of Mathematics at the Institute for Advanced Study in Princeton, New Jersey.[6] Bombieri won the Fields Medal in 1974[5] for his contributions to large sieve mathematics,[7] conceptualized by Linnick 1941,[8][9] and its application to the distribution of prime numbers.[7]
